intro: Medusanthera carolinensis, commonly known as the Carolina medusanthera, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescence that resembles a cluster of small, lantern-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along the edges of swamps and wetlands. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species and is often protected in conservation areas.
